intro: Sphaeralcea coulteri subsp. margaritae, commonly known as Coulter's globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
